= gnext =

 unitptr gnext

== Description ==
Returns the next unit in the global list of units. This is a read-only field of a unitptr.

== Return Value ==
Returns a unitptr pointing to the next unit in the global list, or null if there is no next unit.

== Usage ==
This field is accessed using dot notation on a unitptr variable:
 unitptr next_unit;
 next_unit := current_unit.gnext;

== Example ==
 dilbegin look_signature();
 var
   pc:unitptr;
 code
 {
   heartbeat:=PULSE_SEC*3;
 :start:
   wait (SFB_CMD,(
   (command ("look")) and
   (("signature"==argument ) or ("signatures" == argument))
   ));
   block;
   pc:=ghead();
   sendtext ("The following book signers are on line.<br/><br/>",activator);

   while (pc.type==UNIT_ST_PC)
   {
     if (((isset (pc.pcflags,PC_PK_RELAXED)) or
           (dilfind ("no_kill@function",pc))) and
         (pc.level<200) and
         (visible (activator,pc)))
       sendtext(pc.name+" "+pc.title+"<br/>",activator);
     pc:=pc.gnext;
   }

   goto start;
 } dilend

== Notes ==
* The global list contains all units in the game
* This field is read-only (RO)
* Returns null when called on the last unit in the global list
* Commonly used for iterating through all units in the game

== See Also ==
* [[ghead]] - Get the first unit in the global list
* [[gprevious]] - Get the previous unit in the global list
* [[next]] - Get the next unit in the local list
* [[unitptr]] - Unit pointer documentation
